title: Lesson 9
paragraph: Communication and media connect people and share information. Announcements, articles, broadcasts and online posts reach audiences quickly. Good pronunciation, clear messages and careful presentation help reporters and interviewers explain ideas and translate details for readers and listeners.

words.meaning: a public or formal statement giving information
words.example: The school made an announcement about exam dates.

words.meaning: a written piece in a newspaper, magazine, or website
words.example: She read an article about climate change.

words.meaning: the group of people who watch, listen or read something
words.example: The audience clapped after the speech.

words.meaning: to send out a program or message by radio or TV
words.example: They will broadcast the match live.

words.meaning: a TV or radio station, or a method of communication
words.example: Change the channel to watch the news.

words.meaning: an informal conversation
words.example: We had a quick chat during lunch.

words.meaning: a remark expressing an opinion
words.example: He left a comment on the article.

words.meaning: the act of sharing information or ideas
words.example: Open communication helps teams work better.

words.meaning: to get in touch with someone
words.example: Please contact me if you have questions.

words.meaning: a spoken exchange between two or more people
words.example: They had a long conversation about travel.

words.meaning: a statement that gives details about something
words.example: The description helped me find the book.

words.meaning: a small part or specific piece of information
words.example: He explained every detail of the plan.

words.meaning: a conversation between two or more people
words.example: The dialogue in the play was realistic.

words.meaning: a conversation about a topic to share ideas
words.example: We had a discussion about the project.

words.meaning: a formal conversation where questions are asked
words.example: She gave an interview to the local paper.

words.meaning: an educational talk delivered to an audience
words.example: The lecture covered modern art history.

words.meaning: channels of mass communication such as TV, newspapers, and the internet
words.example: Social media changed how news spreads.

words.meaning: information sent from one person to another
words.example: I left a message for him on his phone.

words.meaning: a printed publication with news and articles
words.example: She reads the newspaper every morning.

words.meaning: connected to the internet
words.japaneseMeaning: オンライン、ネット上で
words.example: We attended the meeting online.

words.meaning: a distinct section of a piece of writing
words.example: Write a paragraph about your hobbies.

words.meaning: a group of words expressing an idea
words.example: Learn useful phrases for travel.

words.meaning: an oral display or explanation of information
words.japaneseMeaning: プレゼンテーション、発表
words.example: Her presentation impressed the audience.

words.meaning: the way a word is spoken
words.example: Practice pronunciation to be understood.

words.meaning: to make content available to the public
words.example: They will publish the results next week.

words.meaning: a person who gathers and reports news
words.example: The reporter interviewed local witnesses.

words.meaning: a critical evaluation of a book, film, or product
words.example: I read a review before watching the movie.

words.meaning: the flat surface on which images are shown
words.example: The movie played on a large screen.

words.meaning: a sound or action that sends information
words.example: The signal indicated the train's arrival.

words.meaning: written words, especially in a message or document
words.example: Send me a text when you arrive.

words.meaning: to change words from one language to another
words.example: Can you translate this sentence to Japanese?

words.meaning: a set of web pages on the internet
words.example: Find the schedule on the event website.
